properties.name: i_note_content
properties.description:
Note to add to the XDR incident worklog. 
Note should be in markdown format. Recommend to use the following format:
### Incident Update - <state> ### 
### Executive Summary: ### 
<Paragraph of high level summary of issue >

### Investigation Details: ### 
<details of analysis in bullet points and/or preformatted text blocks>

### Supporting Evidence: ### 
<Optional but recommended - include logs or api outputs in readable format>

### Next Steps: ### 
<next steps as bulleted or numbered list>
This workflow adds a note to an XDR incident worklog.

actions.name: Execute Python Script
actions.title: Ensure ID is prefixed with incident-

properties.display_name: Ensure ID is prefixed with incident-
properties.script:
import sys

inc_id = sys.argv[1]
if not inc_id.startswith('incident-'):
   inc_id = 'incident-' + inc_id

properties.description: Enhances certain incident updates with an additional LLM call
Uses API to get the l_messages from the parent workflow

properties.script:
import json
import sys
l_messages = sys.argv[1]
i_note_content = sys.argv[2]


system_prompt = """
Act as an escalation level IT Security Operations investigator AI Agent. Review the AI agent generated content and history, then generate a more thorough and enhanced update note of the same state.  The update is about the security incident, NOT the AI agent collecting data. Only return the updated note. Do not change the incident state in your created output. Use markdown format:
### Incident Update - <state> ### 
### Executive Summary: ### 
<>
### Investigation Details: ### 
<>

### Supporting Evidence: ### 
<Optional but recommended - include logs or api outputs in readable format>

### Next Steps: ###
"""

message_format = [
    {
        "role": "system",
        "content": f"{system_prompt}",
    },
    {
        "role": "user",
        "content": f"Original Update Content: {i_note_content}  \n\nMessage History:{l_messages}",
    },
]

output_json = json.dumps(message_format)

properties.name: i_langsmith_parent_run_id
properties.description: Parent run_id . Used for langsmith tracing
Executes a call to the OpenAI chat completion API

properties.script:
import sys
import json

model_id = sys.argv[1]
api_version = sys.argv[2]
is_azure = sys.argv[3]
temperature = float(sys.argv[4])
tools = json.loads(sys.argv[5])
response_format = json.loads(sys.argv[6])
messages = json.loads(sys.argv[7])

if is_azure == 'true':
  is_azure = True
else:
  is_azure = False

if is_azure:
  completions_path = f'/openai/deployments/{model_id}/chat/completions?api-version={api_version}'
  body = {
        "temperature": temperature,
        "stream": False,
        "tools": tools,
        "response_format": response_format,
        "messages": messages
        }
else:
  completions_path = '/chat/completions'
  body = {
        "model": model_id,
        "temperature": temperature,
        "stream": False,
        "tools": tools,
        "response_format": response_format,
        "messages": messages
        }
  
json_body = json.dumps(body)

# Fix for https://github.com/microsoft/semantic-kernel/issues/4447
json_body = json_body.replace('multi_tool_use.parallel','parallel')

body = json.loads(json_body)

if not body['tools']:
  body.pop('tools')

json_body = json.dumps(body)

import datetime
import uuid
import sys
import json
import requests
parent_run_id = sys.argv[1]
langsmith_run_id = sys.argv[3]
langsmith_parent_exists_sc = sys.argv[4]
langsmith_run_name = sys.argv[5]
langsmith_project_name = sys.argv[6]
time = datetime.datetime.utcnow().isoformat()
inputs = json.loads(sys.argv[2])

if not langsmith_run_name:
    langsmith_run_name = 'XDR Automate OpenAIChatCompl'

if parent_run_id:
    # check if parent_run_id exists
    if int(langsmith_parent_exists_sc) == 404 and not langsmith_run_id:
        # parent doesnt exist so lets use it as the run_id
        langsmith_run_id = parent_run_id

if not langsmith_run_id:
  langsmith_run_id = str(uuid.uuid4())

ls_body = {
        "id": langsmith_run_id,
        "extra": {
            "metadata": { "instance_id": "$workflow.definition_workflow_02DCP9NG0ZARR2GH2YD4cxUH7onr6EZ5Tyk.output.instance_id$"}
                 },
        "name": langsmith_run_name,
        "run_type": "llm",
        "start_time": time,
        "session_name": langsmith_project_name,
        "inputs": inputs
}

if parent_run_id and parent_run_id != langsmith_run_id:
    ls_body['parent_run_id'] = parent_run_id

ls_body = json.dumps(ls_body)
